G5291-d-12-29-02-WC.Maintenance Railroad Name: Duluth, Missabe & Iron Range Railway Company
G5291-d-12-29-02-WC.Narrative: WC TRAIN M34042-28 WAS DEPARTING ON THE DMIR MAIN LINE TRACK AT 9 MPH ACCOUNT SLOW ORDER DUE TO PREVIOUS DERAILMENT.  THE TRAIN WAS PULLING IN NOTCH 1 WHEN IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND THE ENGINEER STOPPED HIS TRAIN.  THE CREW FOUND THAT 13 CARS NEAR THE REAR OF THE TRAIN HAD DERAILED ACCOUNT TRACK CONDITIONS IN THIS AREA.  THE DMIR AND WC DO NOT AGREE ON THE CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT.  THE DMIR IS SHOWING IT AS MECHANICAL CAUSED BUT NO DEFECT WAS FOUND WITH THE CARS INVOLVED THAT WOULD'VE CAUSED THE DERAILMENT TO OCCUR.  THIS IS THE SAME AREA THAT THE WC HAD A TRAIN DERAIL APPROXIMATELY 9 DAYS PRIOR TO THIS INCIDENT AND IS THE REASON THE SLOW ORDER WAS PLACED ON THIS TRACK.  THE WC CONTENDS THAT THIS DERAILMENT WAS DUE TO THE TRACK CONDITIONS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

2002101-d-12-07-02-WVRR.Primary Accident Cause: Other rail and joint bar defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
2002101-d-12-07-02-WVRR.Accident Cause: Other rail and joint bar defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
2002101-d-12-07-02-WVRR.Narrative: ON DECEMBER 7, 2002, WHITEWATER VALLEY RAILROAD PASSENGER EXCURSION TRAIN 25X DEPARTED CONNERSVILLE,INDIANA STATION (MP 68.5) AT 5:37 PM FOR METAMORA, INDIANA WITH 386 PASSENGERS.  AT 6:55 PM TRAIN DERAILED AT MP 56.4 AFTER A RAIL BROKE UNDER THE MOVING TRAIN.  THREE PASSENGER CARS DERAILED WHICH WERE THE SIXTH, SEVENTH, AND EIGHTH CARS IN THE CONSIST.  SIXTH AND SEVENTH CARS COMPLETELY DERAILED.EIGHTH CAR HAD ONLY THE FRONT TRUCK DERAILED.  PASSENGERS WERE REMOVED FROM THE SITE BY BUS AND TAKEN TO LAUREL, INDIANA ELEMENTARY SCHOOL BEFORE BEING RELEASED.  TEN PASSENGERS WERE TAKEN TO FAYETTE MEMORIAL HOSPITAL IN CONNERSVILLE.  NINE WERE TREATED AND RELEASED.  ONE WAS KEPT OVERNIGHT FOR OBSERVATION AND RELEASED THE NEXT DAY.  NONE OF THE TRAIN CREW WERE INJURED.  DERAILMENT SITE WAS INSPECTED BY FRA TRACK INSPECTOR THE NEXT MORNING.  CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE A RAIL WHICH BROKE UNDERMOVING TRAIN.  RAIL BREAK WOULD BE DESCRIBED AS AN ORDINARY BREAK.  ANY PRIOR INSPECTION OF RAIL WOULD NOT HAVE NOTICED ANY VISUAL DEFECT.  TRAIN WAS MOVING AT APPROXIMATELY 12 MPH.NoneNoneNoneNone

176919-d-12-22-02-CP.Accident Cause: Failure to allow air brakes to fully release before proceeding (H005)
176919-d-12-22-02-CP.Narrative: CANADIAN PACIFIC TRAIN 166 PULLED TO CLINTON STREET CROSSOVER AND RECEIVED PERMISSION TO CROSS OVERAND ENTER SK YARD.  YARD SWITCH WAS OPEN AND 166 PROCEEDED EAST, HOWEVER TRAIN CAME TO A STOP TO ALLOW CONDUCTOR TO LINE DIVIDER SWITCH TOWARD TRACK BX27.  ENGINEER BROUGHT TRAIN TO A STOP.  ONCE CONDUCTOR LINED THE SWITCH, ENGINEER RELEASED AUTOMATIC BRAKE.  ENGINEER MOVED THROTTLE TO POSITION 1 AND WHEN MOVEMENT STARTED HE MOVED THROTTLE TO NUMBER 2 POSITION AND FELT A SURGE AND IMMEDIATELY DROPPED THROTTLE TO IDLE.  ENGINEER TRIED AGAIN BUT ON SECOND ATTEMPT HE FELT A SURGE AND TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  ENGINEER MOVED APPROXIMATELY 20 OR 30 FEET FROM WHERE HE ORIGINALLY STOPPED ON LEAD.INCIDENT TOOK PLACE ON NS HOWARD STREET RUNNER, CP CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND 8TH, 9TH AND 10THCARS DERAILED.  NS DISPATCHER AND SK YARDMASTER NOTIFIED.  NS INCURRED $14,150 TRACK DAMAGE.  RESPONSIBILITY TO BE PROVIDED UPON COMPLETION OF FORMAL INVESTIGATION RESULTS.  THIS IS A CANADIAN PACIFIC TRAIN (NOT D&H), ON NORFOLK SOUTHERN (NS) TRACK.NoneNoneNoneNone
